page.title: 01Buxhall - Introduction
page.content:
The area covers the majority of the parish of{Buxhall,}including the main concentration of houses and the southern extent of{Rattlesden}parish known as High Town Green. Lying south of the A45 20 kms east of Bury St Edmunds and 8 kms west of Stowmarket it is in the heart of the boulder clay country, known as High Suffolk. The principle activity is arable farming dominating its landscape and economy.
The area is sparsely populated and appears remote from contemporary urban influences. It is relatively flat, at its southern edge rising to approximately 100m, with wide views over the surrounding countryside particularly from the east. In the southwest are the remains of a World War 2 airfield now mainly restored to agriculture.
